title: Ticket #2910: glexec fails when there isn't file transfer
description:
In Condor 7.6.6 (and we believe in Condor 7.7.x), we have discovered that if you use glexec in a Condor pool that does not use file transfer, the starter will not invoke glexec because it cannot access the proxy. It reports the following error message: 

03/30/12 12:18:09 GLExecPrivSepHelper::run_script: not invoking glexec since the proxy is not valid!
03/30/12 12:18:09 ERROR "error changing sandbox ownership to the user" at line 183 in file /builddir/build/BUILD/condor-7.6.6/src/condor_starter.V6.1/glexec_privsep_helper.linux.cpp
03/30/12 12:18:09 ShutdownFast all jobs.
03/30/12 12:18:09 condor_read() failed: recv() returned -1, errno = 104 Connection reset by peer, reading 5 bytes from <131.225.155.31:54716>.
03/30/12 12:18:09 IO: Failed to read packet header

The proxy is valid, but Zach believes that this function is not finding the proxy correctly. (Perhaps it's not looking in the correct directory.)

This hasn't been noticed before because if you have file transfer enabled, there is no problem. Probably people use glexec with file transfer enabled?
